job_title: Registered Nurse%2C Emergency Room in Bradenton, FL
pros: It was close to the interstate and my home, some of the people you work with are amazing.
cons: Administration doesn’t care about employees or their loyalty. They over run and over work their staff. If you disagree or speak out about anything they call it unprofessionalism. Heaven forbid you’re getting ran into the ground and you don’t smile and just deal with it like a stepford nurse. They have no loyalty to their staff and will pay ungodly amounts to travelers but refuse to take care of their permanent staff. Happy nurses week, here’s some candy! Happy holidays, here’s 10 dollar publix gift cards! Thanks for sticking it out through covid, pat on the back and here’s some high paid travelers to work next to but no bonus for you… kudos! SMH gotta love it!

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Lakewood Ranch, FL
pros: The people at this facility are outstanding! I am an experienced ICU nurse who started here as a seasonal employee after being a traveler and loved it so much I stayed on as staff. The people make the difference. No matter where you go this is true. The staff at LWRMC really care about each other and the patients. There is something to be said about having a “work family” and that is exactly how I felt at this hospital. I always felt supported by my team. This facility is the place to go when you are looking for a seasonal contract or when you are ready to settle down and stay local. I hope to go back when I am done traveling 😁
cons: Nursing rates in Florida are low compared to the rest of the country. This is not specific to this facility, just an overall negative for working as a nurse in the state of Florida.

review_title: Worked there twice-Second time was NOT a charm

job_title: Office Manager in Sarasota, FL
pros: There are a lot of great employees at Lakewood Ranch Medical Center and it's a small hospital if that's what you're looking for for employment. Super clean environment.
cons:
The cons with LWR Medical Center is the lack of staff. There is always a huge turnover mainly because of being overworked for low wages. The company works off of productivity, meaning that if it's slow there today then tomorrows schedule for employees will be based on yesterdays slow day, even if the next day is super busy. The stress can get super high with the demand to get your job done, however, it could be improved if the hospital could keep their employees.
There are a lot of jobs within LWR that are PRN, so if your looking for consistent employment with a solid paycheck, then look somewhere else. Once the season is over and all the snowbirds have gone home then your hours are sure to be cut. 
The hospital doesn't offer much when it comes to continued education. $1,000 a year toward schooling for part-timers and $2,000 a year for full-timers. You can definitely get better educational assistance and hourly pay with Sarasota Memorial Hospital.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Manatee, FL
pros: Friendly people to work with almost all of the time, benefits really good, most management knowledgeable.
cons: Micromanagement to an extreme, understaffed more than staffed appropriately.
